meanings.definition: Arousing or deserving of pity or sympathy.
meanings.sent1: The pathetical puppy looked up with sad eyes.
meanings.sent2: The movie's ending was so pathetical that it made everyone cry.
meanings.sent3: The pathetical sight of the abandoned teddy bear tugged at my heartstrings.
meanings.sent4: Her pathetical story was like a broken melody that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The pathetical scene of the old man feeding the birds will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: Expressing or arousing pity or sadness.
meanings.sent1: She wrote a pathetical poem about lost love.
meanings.sent2: The pathetical music touched the audience's hearts.
meanings.sent3: His pathetical attempt at humor fell flat with the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The pathetical painting captured the essence of loneliness.
meanings.sent5: The pathetical expression on her face revealed her inner turmoil.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or showing a lack of emotional strength or self-control.
meanings.sent1: His pathetical breakdown at work surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The pathetical display of anger was out of character for him.
meanings.sent3: The pathetical outburst of tears caught us off guard.
meanings.sent4: Her pathetical response to criticism showed her vulnerability.
meanings.sent5: The pathetical lack of confidence in his voice was evident to all.
